comments.body: Oh, sorry I let this one slip. Thanks.
Was this meant to be part of the PR? It might be better to add it in a separate PR
Also note that the indentation is off here.

I may have been a little fast on this part too. 

Having more precise types should be an improvement (for instance a PointsMaterial is not supposed to be passed as a material for a Mesh). But this change creates a new intermediate type for a very basic use, though this type is not documented and neither exported. So during development, if a wrong material is passed in, or a wrong type casted, VSCode complains that the `MeshMaterial` type is not respected, which is surprising.

What do you think a nice solution can be ?
